content:
The tests are not equivalent to validators and there's way too few of them. There's not even a single test case that requires you to have implemented bronze leagues! You should make sure the tests cover all ranks.

You're also missing (visible) tests for:
* Going above legend 100 pts.
* Edge case where you end up on exactly 0 or 100 points

You're also missing validators for:
* Going below wood 2
* Edge case where you end up on exactly 0 points (in any of the leagues above Wood 2)
* Rising or dropping more than one league

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Cool problem, clear and concise statement makes it easy to get in one read. Difficulty is about what i like in clashes, and its not based on some math formula, just good old coding.  Overall, cool clash, approved.

Comment: Great clash, especially for a speed contest as there are different ways of coding the solution with some more efficient than others so it is also a good way to learn for players who will take some time to solve it.
Interesting and fun

Looks good. My first solution (looks almost exactly like yours in fact) used "> 100" instead of ">= 100" for ascending ranks, so I failed the last validator. I think a lot of people will make this mistake, so maybe you should swap Test 4 and Validator 4.

Made a few edits to the prompt for legibility and standard formatting.

Goal section:
* "leader" should be "ladder".
* "ouput" should be "output".
* Please change "current" to "new" to be clearer.
* Please explain the order of the ranks - I know it is common sense to assume Wood is the lowest and Legend is the highest, but the statement should spell it out.
* Please explain what the numbers in the brackets mean (including the order).
* Please explain how the points will change when you pass to a new rank or when you lose a rank.
* Please add the explanation on Legend rank in this section:
When your rank is Legend, your points can increase infinitely but no further rank promotion will be available.
* Please add the explanation on Wood 2 rank in this section:
When your rank is Wood 2, your points will never become negative. The minimum points you will have is 0.

Input section:
* Please delete "Input:"
* "An string" should be "A string".
* And suggest to change Line 1 description as:
A string [[current_rank]] for your current rank and your current points, separated with a comma
* Suggest to make format the word "lose" as bold, instead of "game" as bold.
* "Exemple" should be "Example".
* Please move the example in both the Input section and the Output section to the Goal section.
* Then in the example, please explain your calculation and how you arrive at your output.

Output section:
* Please delete "Ouput:".
* Suggest to change Line 1 description as:
A string for your new rank and your new points, separated with a comma
* Please delete the "carfull" paragraph.

Constraints:
* Please delete "None".

Stub generator:
* Please use the same variable names as in the statement.

Thanks.
Feel free to give feedback ðŸ˜Š

I think I have change all you asked for.
If they are still things to change tell me.

Thank ðŸ˜Š

Going above legend 100 pts => last test named "Legends never die"
Edge case where you end up on exactly 0 or 100 points =>  "Gg wp ez "

And for the validators everythink is fine

No. You're missing that validators are different thing than test cases. Test cases are what players see when playing. Validators are what are used when you submit to calculate your score. Both tests AND validators should test all relevant cases. You can see under the "Test cases" section half of the tests are marked "TEST" and half are marked "VALIDATOR".

Oh !
I see. Thank you I will fix that :p

Thank you, it looks much better now! Just a few more finishing touches:

Goal section:
* Suggest to change "Legend" to "and Legend is the highest rank".
* Please add "Example:" in front of "95 + 10" and "5 - 10".
* Please add the explanation on Wood 2 rank (if my understanding is wrong please feel free to change it):
When your rank is Wood 2, your points will never become negative. The minimum points you will have is 0.

Input section:
* Please delete "actually".
Oky, this time it is all good (I swear ðŸ˜…)
